column4: I did check for startup bugs, but there wasn't anything reported which would exactly correspond my situation. I also removed apache2 using bum and set it back. Everything seems to be fine, but it still fails to start. And logs won't contain anything helpful.
ls -l /etc/rc*/*apache2*
hit, rc0-6 all levels linked to init.d/apache2
can you just pastebin?
naturally. http://pastebin.com/DGC0Z5rk
the releases notes says there were some changes to how upstart handles the sys-v-init scripts, I'd start there.  Anything interesting in /etc/default/apache2?
not as far as I know. http://pastebin.com/nHi7utVp
more reliable handling of legacy sysvinit scripts I'd try to figure out what that means :P

Yep. I did fair share of Googling before ending here. Because I didn't find anything that really would solve the issue. But I'm sure googling after a while or some update will fix the problem. The trick by ActionS works just fine before that.
I do use piping to logrotate, if it could have anything to do with this. Otherwise all configs are pretty simple.
do any other scripts in /etc/init.d fail?
mononofu: use gconftool-2
mononofu: erm, not sure if that's true with unity actually
nope, not anymore. But used to, because some paths were missing. lock pid paths etc...
my friends server failed to start sphinxsearch due /var/run/sphinxsearch path missing
So it seems quite common that some paths need to be created after dist-upgrade.
well that's in the release notes (the change to /var/run and some other directories)
!notes | sl__
maybe that's what you need to do
so maybe some config was changet do look at /run instead of /var/run?
what's the output of: grep -i '^concurrency=' /etc/init.d/rc
